text: 22 oz bottle via trade shared with Tmoney99 and the Nine Giant crew. Pours a dark cola brown color with a small beige head that settled into a ring. The aroma and flavor have bigger dark fruits, molasses, sweet but without being cloying, background chocolate and caramel, whiskey, hints of wood, some viscosity, good mouthfeel.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06. Poured dark brown with a moderate frothy tan head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy toasted malt, wood with alcohol aroma. Full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy dark sweet flavor with a medium to heavy complex sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a standout beer

On tap @ Mikkeller & Friends Copenhagen. Jet black with tiny espresso head. Nose is dark roasted malts, mocha coffee, whisky, oak wood, dried plums. Taste is sweet upfront with the whisky leading the way. Roasted malts, dried dark fruits, coffee and slightly smoked oak wood follow. Moderately warming boozy finish. Sticky, syrupy and thick mouthfeel. Low carbonation.
[5/9/17] Draught at Mikkeller & Friends in Copenhagen. Black with a tan head. Whiskey, malt, caramel, nuts, roast, chocolate, dark fruits, some alcohol, vanilla, sweet, chewy, full-bodied.

(On tap @ Mikkeller and Friends, Copenhagen, May 9/17) Pours black with a small tan ring of head. Aroma of molasses, dark fruit, Irish whiskey, umami, burnt sugar, roasted grain, subtle vanilla, maybe some spice, weird thing that recalls pub food - some strange sensory association?! Flavour is very sweet molasses, dark fruits, treacle, dark barley wine feel, wood, sweeter whiskey, light liquorice, some burnt grain but low roastiness overall. Spirit heat in the finish is all that really dries it. Medium-full body, a bit syrupy, soft carbonation. This is just too sweet relative to its roast for my tastes, the flavours are good but the drinkability low.

Bottle with a huge hanks to Michael. Black pour with a small light brown head. Nose is amaze balls vanilla. Lots of smooth oak. Subtle pepper and booze. Taste is all smooth cocoa. Subtle bitterness. Moderately sweet but not cloying. Light coffee. Lightly milk sugar sweetness. Really nice.

From tap at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Black color with beige brown head. Malty aroma, roasted, chocolate, caramel, bread notes, soy sauce notes, wood, whiskey - alcohol. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.

On tap. Black color with dark brown head. Aroma has whiskey, fudge, some spiced chocolate and dried fruits. Taste is sweet, sticky with dried fruits flavor, similar to a barleywine with whiskey and toffee notes. Medium body and carbonation.
Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends, Copenhagen. Black pour with a minimal head. Tons of whiskey here, barrel, vanilla, booze, light roast, caramel and some cocoa.

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Black with small beige head. Aroma is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, bourbon and liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, sweet, liquorice, bourbon and warming.

14.05.2017, tap @ Mikkeller & Friends:
Nice slightly fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is sweet mineraly, dark sugar, caramel, raisins, oak, minerals, mild bourbon, bark, toffee, toast, sweet chocolate, vanilla, even more dark sugar. Taste is slightly sweet mineraly, dark sugar, minerals, oak, mild bourbon, vanilla, sweet chocolate, bark, even more dark sugar, caramel, raisins, toast. Medium bitterness, sweet mineraly mouthfeel. Light and easy drinking, but way to sweet...

On tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Black with a small tan head. Sweet with malt, coffee, chocolate, caramel and some bourbon. The body was medium and the carbonation was soft. Warming alcohol in the finish.
Wanilia, Bourbon, mleczna czekolada, lekka paloność. Słodkie, pełne, pyszne.
bottle, OOF. This was bad A strong plain roasty base, very thick with too much molasses sweetness, then a sweet boozy spicy malty covering, over the entire beer. Really not for me.

Intense caramel, dark, sweet, toasted malts, whiskey barrels, dark chocolate, dark, dried fruits. Black, tiny, creamy, off-white head. Heavy sweet. More rich, intense dark, dried fruits, prunes, chocolate, moist pralines, molasses, soft carbonation, full bodied. Beautiful ASA, complex, rich. Keg at Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma of roasty malts, sweet whisky, oak, wood and syrup notes. Taste is sweet, sticky and syrupy with some roastiness, loads of whisky, oak and woody notes. Finish is sweet, sticky and slightly stuffy with some syrup, wood, oak, toffee and caramel notes. Heavy and sweet.
Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of coffee, chocolate, vanilla, light bourbon. Taste is very sweet, mild vanilla and chocolate finish. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.

Pours dark with minimal tanned head 
Aromas of vinous red berries, leather, coffee, some chocolate, oak, figs, dates 
Taste has creamy, thick notes of coffee, vanilla, chocolate, vanilla, leather, soy

Pours black with a low tan head. Aromas of caramel, bourbon, vanilla, muscovado sugar. Taste is caramel and nutty notes with some spices. Mouthfeel is surprisingly light bodied with low carbonation. A bit too light and unbalanced.

Keg at the mikkeller and friend 2017. Mdark black... Thin tan lacing.. Soft sweet chocolate roast malts nose.. Dark chocolate roast malts.. Heavy sweet chocolate roast malts.. Rich dark sweet chocolate malts

Tap @ Mikkeller & Friends. Black with a light brown head. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, wood and whisky. Flavor is quite sweet and moderate bitter. Sweet and moderate bitter finish with a little warming alcohol. 110517
Tap m&f. Pours black with a tan head. Aroma of ryebread, maple, sugary, bourbon, woody. Taste is heavy sugar, bourbon, rye, heavy roast, licorice.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours black with a brown head. Aroma of sweet malt, caramel, wood, light chocolate, wood, whiskey. Flavor is sweet, rich malty, caramel, chocolate, dried fruit, wood, sweet whiskey. Medium to full body, oily mouthfeel, soft carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 110517

Tap @ Mikkeller and Friends. Pours black with a small dark brown head. Aromas of bready malts, vanilla, fudge, dark fruits, tannins, butterscotch, huge caramel and cocoa! Taste is sweet, lots of fruit, malty, some boozy warming notes, fudge, vanilla, lots of caramel, light tobacco.
At Mikkeller and Friends, Pours black with a beige head, aroma of rum, fruits, coconut, flavor is sweet with rum, bourbon, coconut, fruits, full bodied, Great

Tap at Mikkeller and Friends, Copenhagen. Poured a clear dark brown with a thin tan head. The aroma is rich roasty malt, sweet fruits, molasses. The flavour is moderate to strong sweet with a rich oily sticky sugary red berry fruit light alcohol palate. Full bodied with flat carbonation.

Draft at Mikkeller. Pours black with a small tan head. Sweet malts, chocolate, syrupy booze, toffee, apparently its Jameson but feels like cognac or brandy, nice roast, molasses. Over medium sweet, light bitter. Over medium body, low carbonation.
On tap at Mikkeller & Friends. Pitch black with a tan head. Notes of coffee, chocolate, whiskey, cognac, light raisins, caramelized fruit, espresso. Smooth mouthfeel, full body. Delicious!

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends.
Black colored with a small beige head.
Roasted aroma of caramel, chocolate and dried fruits.
Roasted flavor of caramel and dark chocolate with notes of dried fruits.
Roasted finish.
From tap at M&F. A dark brown to black coloured beer with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of malt, wood, chocolate, whiskey and roasted notes.
From tap. Pours pitch black with a small brown head. Aroma is dense whiskey and roasted malt. Sweet, syrupy. Lingering thick sweet malty. Whiskey and dense malty far finish.

Draft. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of chocolate, bourbon, and roasted malt. The flavor is sweet with notes roasted malt, straw chocolate, and bourbon, leading to a bitter finish.

Sweet malty aroma and taste, with thick tracks and some chocolate, resonating whisky soaked notes int the finish. Lovely.

Backlog, bottle shared by a friend, poured dark black with a tanned head. Dark roast, chocolate, stronger barrel character, char, light vanilla. Taste is full, char, whisky and dark chocolate. Medium bodied. Would love to see these guys got their hands on Some peated whisky barrel

Pours black with a deep tan head. Aroma is chocolate, whiskey, roasted malts, molasses, OMG! Taste OMG! Molasses and chocolate in perfect balance, a beautiful caramel verging on butterscotch presence, honey, rich roasted malts, and finishing with bitter chocolate and oaky barrel flavors. Son! This is awesome. American Strong Ale? - move over Hunahpu, theres someone new in town!

650 mL bottle. Black body. Smells of chocolate, strong nutty malts, Irish whiskey is prevalent. Smells very sweet. Tastes of whiskey and dark chocolate. Becomes sweet chocolate. Whiskey comes back with a sharp bite. Oaky finish. Heavy. Very sweet. Tasty, but heavily sweet.

Bottle from Cycle. Pours a deep stout brown with a tan head. Nose is chocolate, earth, tar, roast, vanilla, slight toffee. Flavor is similar with roast, earth, chocolate, asphalt, vanilla, spirit, almost brandy, but I know its Jamesons. Flavor also hits with rum-soaked raisins, toffee, some vanilla, mild coconut, and lingering earthy sweetness. Medium to full in body and very sweet overall. A bit boozy as it warms.
Bottle. Dark brown pour with a mocha head. Chocolate and barrel bouquet. Sweet with loads of caramels. Mild scotch and oak undercurrents. Good body and mouthfeel.
Bottle - pours dark brown tan head - nose/taste of whiskey, Jameson, oak, molasses, caramel, dark fruit - medium body
Bottle. Dark pour with light head. Jameson, chocolate, sweet and dry malt aromas. Flavors are sweet, Jameson, oak and chocolate tones.
